Section.Label: Chapter_Functionality_Section_Methods
Section.Heading: Methods

ManSection.Description: The argument of this category is any permutation group, G. Checks whether G is a regular rooted tree group.
The argument of this attribute is any regular rooted tree group, G.
The argument of this attribute is any regular rooted tree group, G.

ManSection.Returns: The regular rooted tree group G as an object of the category , with attributes and .
ManSection.Description: The arguments of this operation are a regular rooted tree group, G, and its degree k and depth n.
The argument of this property is any regular rooted tree group, G. Tests whether G satisfies the self-replicating conditions.
The argument of this property is any regular rooted tree group, G. Tests whether G has sufficient rigid automorphisms.

ManSection.Returns: The image of G when projected onto the automorphism group of degree k and depth n-1.
ManSection.Description: The argument of this attribute is any regular rooted tree group, G, of degree k and depth n.

ManSection.Returns: The maximal extension of G, M(G), that is a subgroup of the automorphism group of degree k and depth n+1.
ManSection.Description: The argument of this attribute is any regular rooted tree group, G, of degree k and depth n.

ManSection.Returns: A conjugate of G with sufficient rigid automorphisms.
ManSection.Description: The argument of this attribute is any regular rooted tree group, G.

Section.Label: Chapter_Functionality_Section_Library_Functions
Section.Heading: Library Functions

ManSection.Returns: The numth self-replicating group of degree k and depth n stored in the SRGroups library.
ManSection.Description: The argument of this function is a degree, k, a depth, n, and a designated number of the stored self-replicating group, num.

ManSection.Returns: All of the self-replicating group(s) stored as objects satisfying all of the provided input arguments.
ManSection.Description: Main library search function. Has several possible input arguments such as Degree, Level (or Depth), Number, Projection, Subgroup, Size, NumberOfGenerators, and IsAbelian. Order of the inputs do not matter.

ManSection.Returns: Information about the self-replicating group(s) satisfying all of the provided input arguments in list form: [Generators, Name, Parent Name, Children Name(s)]. If the Position input is provided, only the corresponding index of this list is returned.
ManSection.Description: Inputs work the same as the main library search function , with one additional input: Position.

ManSection.Returns: Whether all of the self-replicating groups of degree k and level n project correctly to level n-1.
ManSection.Description: The arguments of this function are a degree, k, and a level, n.

Section.Example: gap> CheckSRProjections(2,4); All groups project correctly.

ManSection.Returns: All of the degrees currently stored in the SRGroups library (duplicates included).
ManSection.Description: There are no inputs to this function.

ManSection.Returns: All of the levels currently stored in the SRGroups library for an input RegularRootedTreeGroupDegree, deg.
ManSection.Description: The input to this function is the degree of the regular rooted tree, k.

Section.Label: Chapter_Functionality_Section_Package_Functions
Section.Heading: Package Functions

ManSection.Returns: The regular rooted tree group \mathrm{Aut}(T_{k,n}) as a permutation group of the k^{n} leaves of T_{k,n}.
ManSection.Description: The arguments of this function are a degree k \in\mathbb{N}_{\ge 2} and a depth n \in\mathbb{N}.

ManSection.Returns: The restriction of aut to the subtree below the level 1 vertex i, as an element of AutT(k,n-1).
ManSection.Description: The arguments of this function are a degree, k \in\mathbb{N}_{\ge 2}, a depth, n \in\mathbb{N}, an element of AutT(k,n), aut, and a level 1 vertex, i \in\{1,\cdots,k\}.
The arguments of this function are a group, G, and a list of groups, grouplist. For every group H1 in grouplist, this function removes all conjugate groups H2 such that H2\in H1^G.

ManSection.Returns: A list containing conjugacy class representatives of all maximal self-replicating subgroups of G.
ManSection.Description: The argument of this function is any regular rooted tree group, G

ManSection.Returns: A list containing conjugacy class representatives of all self-replicating subgroups of the maximal extension of G, M(G).
ManSection.Description: The argument of this function is any regular rooted tree group, G

The arguments of this function are a degree, k, or 0. If the argument is non-zero, this function creates the file containing all self-replicating groups of the regular rooted k-tree at the lowest level not stored in the SRGroups library. If the argument is 0, this function creates the file containing all self-replicating groups of the regular rooted tree at the level 1 for the lowest degree not stored in the SRGroups library. The file naming convention is "sr_k_n.grp", and they are stored in the "data" folder of the SRGroups package. Level 1 groups are calculated using the transgrp library. If the argument is non-zero and there is a gap between files (i.e. if "sr_k_n.grp" and "sr_k_n+2.grp" exists, but "sr_k_n+1.grp" does not exist), then this function creates the files in this gap.

Section.Example: gap> SRGroupFile(2); You have requested to make group files for degree 2. Creating level 3 file. Evaluating groups extending from: SRGroup(2,2,1) (1/3) SRGroup(2,2,2) (2/3) SRGroup(2,2,3) (3/3) SRGroup(2,2,4) (4/3) Formatting file sr_2_3.grp now. Reordering individual files. Done. gap> SRGroupFile(0); Creating degree 5 file on level 1. Done. gap> SRGroupFile(2); You have requested to make group files for degree 2. Gap found; missing file from level 2. Creating the missing file now. Creating files: sr_2_2.grp Done.

ManSection.Description: The arguments of this function are: arg[1]: degree of tree (int > 1), k, arg[2]: highest level of tree where the file "sr_k_n.grp" exists (int > 1), n, (arg[3],arg[4],...): sequence of group numbers to extend from using the files "temp_k_n_arg[3]_arg[4]_...arg[Length(arg)-1].grp". This function creates the file of the group number arg[Length(arg)] stored in the file "temp_k_n_arg[3]_arg[4]_...arg[Length(arg)-1].grp", and saves it as "temp_k_n_arg[3]_arg[4]_...arg[Length(arg)].grp".

The arguments of this function are a degree, k, and a level, n, of a regular rooted tree, n-1 is the highest level stored as the file "sr_k_n-1.grp" in the SRGroups library, and all of the files "temp_k_n-1_i_proj.grp" for every SRGroup(k,n-1,i) are stored in the "data/temp_k_n" folder of the SRGroups library. This function combines each of the "temp_k_n-1_i_proj.grp" files into the complete "temp_k_n.grp" file to be used by the function.
